title: Negative sample generator can return positive samples and isn't GC matched.
body:
The [function](https://github.com/kundajelab/mseqgen/blob/8078f4057f641d89c9f8a5501e8836af6602e1b1/mseqgen/generators.py#L511) to generate negative (non-peak) input sequences randomly samples across all chromosomes. 
Issues:
- You can get a positive sample because peak regions are not excluded.
- There's no GC-matching.

The parameter that controls negative sampling in the [basepairmodels repo](https://github.com/kundajelab/basepairmodels) is: ```negative-sampling-rate```. 
If the basepairmodels repo is intended for training only on peak regions or with user-specified negative regions, this parameter shouldn't exist. A temporary fix would be to output a warning when the user selects a ```negative-sampling-rate```>0.

title: Implement batch generator to combine foreground and background loci
body:
1. The input json will have new field for background loci
2. The user will specify #samples for foreground and background (-1 for all)
3. The `background_only` option will dictate whether the bed file in the background_loci field of the input json will have weight as zero or one for mnll loss (e.g. in case of training background model the weight for background_loci will be 1)
